name: The Inn at Nakoma
description: Discover a sanctuary of style and serenity nestled in fragrant pine forests, just 45 minutes from Truckee-Tahoe. The Inn at Nakoma blends modern comfort with lodge-inspired design, offering 42 thoughtfully appointed rooms and suites featuring Frette Italian linens, pillow-top beds, Keurig coffee makers, and flat-screen TVs — all set against forest or golf-course views.
shortDescription: Lodge-inspired resort with 42 rooms, Frette linens, the Dragon golf course, Fifty44 Restaurant, and full spa in the Lost Sierra.
highlights: Home of the Dragon Golf Course & driving range
Fifty44 Restaurant & Bar + Middle Fork Bistro
The Spa at Nakoma + heated pool & two hot tubs
Dog-friendly (2 dogs up to 75 lbs each)
amenities: Dragon Golf Course (on-site, Frank Lloyd Wright concept)
The Spa at Nakoma (massages, facials, body treatments)
Altitude Recreation Center (12,000 sq ft, opened 2017)

faqs.question: Is Nakoma Resort close to the Dragon Golf Course?
faqs.answer: The Dragon Golf Course is on-site at Nakoma Resort. Walk from your room to the first tee in minutes.

faqs.question: What room types are available for golf groups?
faqs.answer: Nakoma offers lodge rooms, spa villas with private hot tubs, and multi-bedroom townhome residences perfect for groups of 4-12.

faqs.question: How far is Nakoma from other Graeagle-area courses?
faqs.answer: Graeagle Meadows is 10 minutes, Plumas Pines is 12 minutes, and Whitehawk Ranch is about 20 minutes.

contentParagraphs: Discover a sanctuary of style and serenity nestled in fragrant pine forests, just 45 minutes from Truckee-Tahoe. The Inn at Nakoma blends modern comfort with lodge-inspired design, offering 42 thoughtfully appointed rooms and suites featuring Frette Italian linens, pillow-top beds, Keurig coffee makers, and flat-screen TVs — all set against forest or golf-course views. King rooms average 400 square feet with either golf course or forest views.

Start your day in cozy luxury: savor cooked-to-order breakfasts (8–11 AM) or unwind by the lobby fireplace, take refreshing dips in the heated outdoor pool, and relax in two hot tubs. Fitness fans and spa lovers alike can enjoy the gym and climbing wall at Altitude — Nakoma's 12,000-square-foot recreation center unveiled in 2017 — or indulge in deep-tissue massages, body treatments, and facials at The Spa at Nakoma.

Adventure is just steps away — play a round on the famed Dragon golf course (designed around a Frank Lloyd Wright concept from 1923, built in 2001), hit the driving range, or explore the area's hiking, snowshoeing, and snow-tubing trails. Kids and families will love the arcade, game room, children's club, and theater inside Altitude, while couples will savor the spa and mountain ambiance.

During evenings, treat yourself to elevated fare at Fifty44 Restaurant & Bar, located in the iconic Frank Lloyd Wright-inspired Lodge — enjoy wood-fired dishes and sweeping Sierra views from the majestic fireplace room or summer deck. For something more casual, the Middle Fork Bistro + Bar in Altitude serves craft cocktails, flatbreads, hearty salads, and small plates with soaring ceilings and walls of glass.
Family and pet lovers rejoice: the Inn welcomes up to two dogs (up to 75 lbs each), with access to nearby forest trails for both you and your four-legged friends to roam.
